page.title: 09R.S.R.E. DEFFORD
page.content: The{Defford}branch of the{Royal {Signals and Radar Establishment}is part of the{Ministry of Defence}and is situated on what was the old{Defford {airfield.}Taken off{Croome Court during the war,it was used as an airfield until{1957}when it was handed back. When the{Earl of Coventry}died the estate and airfield was sold. Most of the land was sold to the{Sunlife {Insurance Company. R.S.R.E.}rent{44.2 acres from the company. { Farmer Troughton}owns the farm land around{R.S.R.E.}and this is the only contact they have with the{Defford people. Many workers come from{R.S.R.E. {Malvern}especially the scientists because of the training needed. There are approximately 100 workers at the site. At R.S.R.E.the work they are doing is
